description: see http://hl7.org/fhir/json.html#schema for information about the FHIR Json Schemas

allOf.description: Financial instrument which may be used to pay for or reimburse health care products and services.

identifier.description: The main (and possibly only) identifier for the coverage - often referred to as a Member Id, Subscriber Id, Certificate number or Personal Health Number or Case ID.

status.description: The status of the resource instance.

issuer.description: The program or plan underwriter or payor including both insurance and non-insurance agreements, such as patient-pay agreements.

isAgreement.description: A self, or other, payment agreement not an insurance policy.

period.description: Time period during which the coverage is in force. A missing start date indicates the start date isn't known, a missing end date means the coverage is continuing to be in force.

type.description: The type of coverage: social program, medical plan, accident coverage (workers compensation, auto), group health.

planholder.description: The party who 'owns' the insurance contractual relationship to the policy or to whom the benefit of the policy is due.

beneficiary.description: The party who benefits from the insurance coverage.

relationship.description: The relationship of beneficiary (patient) (subscriber) to the the planholder.

group.description: A suite of underwrite specific classifiers, for example may be used to identify a class of coverage or employer group, Policy, Plan.

dependent.description: A unique identifier for a dependent under the coverage.

sequence.description: An optional counter for a particular instance of the identified coverage which increments upon each renewal.

network.description: The identifier for a community of providers.

contract.description: The policy(s) which constitute this insurance coverage.

allOf.description: Financial instrument which may be used to pay for or reimburse health care products and services.

group.description: Identifies a style or collective of coverage issues by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify a class of coverage or employer group. May also be referred to as a Policy or Group ID.

groupDisplay.description: A short description for the group.

subGroup.description: Identifies a style or collective of coverage issues by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify a class of coverage or employer group. May also be referred to as a Policy or Group ID.

subGroupDisplay.description: A short description for the subgroup.

plan.description: Identifies a style or collective of coverage issues by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify a class of coverage or employer group. May also be referred to as a Policy or Group ID.

planDisplay.description: A short description for the plan.

subPlan.description: Identifies a sub-style or sub-collective of coverage issues by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify a specific employer group within a class of employers. May be referred to as a Section or Division ID.

subPlanDisplay.description: A short description for the subplan.

class.description: Identifies a style or collective of coverage issues by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify a class of coverage or employer group.

classDisplay.description: A short description for the class.

subClass.description: Identifies a sub-style or sub-collective of coverage issues by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify a subclass of coverage or employer group.

subClassDisplay.description: A short description for the subclass.
